summaryText: Wow, what a powerful sermon about relationships, singleness, and finding true satisfaction! Pastor Travis Hearn delivered an incredibly transparent and humorous message about marriage, dating, and most importantly, finding fulfillment in God. PT broke down the complexities of relationships with his signature blend of biblical wisdom and real-world humor. Drawing from John 4, he explored the concept of 'thirst' - not just physical thirst, but the deep soul-level thirst that only Jesus can truly quench. He candidly discussed how many people are 'thirsty' in their relationships, desperately seeking companionship in all the wrong places. The key takeaway? Seek God first, and everything else will follow. Whether you're single or married, the real secret to satisfaction isn't a relationship status, but a relationship with Jesus. Pastor Travis hilariously illustrated this through personal stories, like how he met his wife while pursuing God, not pursuing a relationship. Can you imagine being so focused on God that love finds you? That's the beautiful picture he painted! The sermon wasn't just about finding a spouse, but about finding your purpose and contentment in Christ. His message rings true: marriage won't complete you, but a relationship with Jesus will fill every empty space in your heart.
mainPoints: Seek God first, not a relationship
Marriage is a gift to be stewarded, not a solution to loneliness
True satisfaction comes only through a relationship with Jesus

versesMentioned.text: When a Samaritan woman came to draw water, Jesus said to her, 'Will you give me a drink?' His disciples had gone into the town to buy food. The Samaritan woman said to him, 'You are a Jew and I am a Samaritan woman. How can you ask me for a drink?' Jesus answered her, 'If you knew the gift of God and who it is that asks you for a drink, you would have asked him and he would have given you living water.'
The Lord God said, 'It is not good for the man to be alone. I will make a helper suitable for him.'
He who finds a wife finds what is good and receives favor from the Lord.
But seek first his kingdom and his righteousness, and all these things will be given to you as well.

Submit to one another out of reverence for Christ. Wives, submit yourselves to your own husbands as you do to the Lord... Husbands, love your wives, just as Christ loved the church and gave himself up for her.

I want you to be free from concerns. An unmarried man is concerned about the Lord's affairs—how he can please the Lord. But a married man is concerned about the affairs of this world—how he can please his wife—and his interests are divided.

Monday.scripture: Psalm 37:4: 'Take delight in the Lord, and he will give you the desires of your heart.'
Monday.action: Make a list of your top 3 personal desires. Spend time in prayer, surrendering each desire to God and asking Him to align your heart with His will.
Monday.prayer: Lord, help me to find my complete satisfaction in You. Redirect my heart's desires to match Your perfect plan for my life. Teach me to delight in You above all else. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: Jeremiah 29:11: 'For I know the plans I have for you,' declares the Lord, 'plans to prosper you and not to harm you, plans to give you hope and a future.'
Tuesday.action: Journal about your current season of life. Reflect on how you can serve God and grow spiritually right now, regardless of your relationship status.
Tuesday.prayer: Heavenly Father, help me to be content in this season. Show me how I can use this time to grow closer to You and serve Your kingdom. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: Proverbs 3:5-6: 'Trust in the Lord with all your heart and lean not on your own understanding; in all your ways submit to him, and he will make your paths straight.'
Wednesday.action: Create a surrender prayer list. Write down your relationship hopes and fears, then physically give them to God through prayer.
Wednesday.prayer: God, I surrender my expectations and timeline. Help me trust Your perfect plan and timing for my life. Give me patience and peace. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: 1 Peter 5:7: 'Cast all your anxiety on him because he cares for you.'
Thursday.action: Identify one specific anxiety about relationships. Spend time in prayer, intentionally releasing this concern to God.
Thursday.prayer: Lord, I give You my fears and anxieties. Replace my worry with Your perfect peace. Help me trust Your plan completely. Amen.

Friday.scripture: Romans 8:28: 'And we know that in all things God works for the good of those who love him, who have been called according to his purpose.'
Friday.focus: Seeing God's purpose in every season
Friday.action: Reflect on past relationship experiences. Journal how God has been faithful and used those experiences to shape you.
Friday.prayer: Father, help me see Your hand in my life's journey. Transform my perspective to see challenges as opportunities for growth. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: Isaiah 43:19: 'See, I am doing a new thing! Now it springs up; do you not perceive it? I am making a way in the wilderness and streams in the wasteland.'
Saturday.focus: Staying open to God's unexpected plans
Saturday.action: Do something out of your comfort zone that could potentially connect you with new community or opportunities.
Saturday.prayer: God, make me flexible and open to Your unexpected plans. Help me step out in faith and trust Your guidance. Amen.
